name: 2014_05_humanities_student_major_796_uci
title: 2014-05-humanities-student-major_796_UCI.txt
content_scrubbed:
IIRC, when you turn in your housing application online, there is a section for preferred roommates (i. e. People you already know and want to live with).

**Things to Consider About Middle Earth**

*  Middle is Actually on Campus, so you can literally get to class in 5-10 minutes if you happen to wake up late. You are located near Social Sciences, which is actually where a lot of first years have classes due to GEs. In addition, you are WAYYY closer to the ARC than Mesa is.
* The better food is closer. Brandywine (mostly ideal for lunch) and Pippin (better for dinner) is located in Middle. Mesa Commons is okay in my opinion, but has gotten a lot better over the years
* You get Keycards instead of Keys. Probably easier to carry around over a set of keys.

**Things to Consider About Mesa**

* Rooms are generally bigger than Middle. E. g. The Triple in Mesa is a lot better than the Triple in Middle.
* You have to cross a street/bridge to get on campus. Mesa is located by the Arts side, and is closer to the Student Center and Humanties. Generally needs a bit more time to get to class compared to Middle ~5 more minutes. You can get to ARC by shuttle, but it takes a while since it has to go around.
* IIRC Mesa will sometimes give you free scantrons by the Center. Compared to Middle, there are more places to study outside of your dorm room.

Honestly, there[.] only a few things that are really -THAT- different. Lots of people say things about the kinds of people for Middle and Mesa, it[.] kind of a bunch of crap. People are awesome either way.

That being said I lived in Middle when I was a freshmen, and I would not change it after having lived there.
